The adjusted R 2 (Eq. 3.30 of Chatterjee and Hadi
62 ) is used to quantify the added value in using a polynomial best fit (e.g., T ~ a × TI
(IPWP)
2) instead of a linear best fit (e.g., T ~ b × TI
(IPWP) ). The adjusted R 2 takes into account the likehood that a polynomial predictor will reduce the residuals by unphysically over-fitting the data. The polynomial fit could be preferred if the adjusted R 2 for the polynomial fit is larger as compared to the linear R 2.
